definitions.definition: The portion of the upper human appendage, from the shoulder to the wrist and sometimes including the hand.
definitions.example: She stood with her right arm extended and her palm forward to indicate “Stop!”

definitions.definition: The extended portion of the upper limb, from the shoulder to the elbow.
definitions.example: The arm and forearm are parts of the upper limb in the human body.

definitions.definition: A limb, or locomotive or prehensile organ, of an invertebrate animal.
A long, narrow, more or less rigid part of an object extending from the main part or centre of the object, such as the arm of an armchair, a crane, a pair of spectacles or a pair of compasses.
definitions.example: The robot arm reached out and placed the part on the assembly line.

definitions.definition: A bay or inlet off a main body of water.
definitions.example: Shelburne Bay is an arm of Lake Champlain.

definitions.definition: A branch of an organization.
definitions.example: the cavalry arm of the military service

definitions.definition: Power; might; strength; support.
A pitcher
definitions.example: The team needs to sign another arm in the offseason.

definitions.definition: One of the two parts of a chromosome.
A group of patients in a medical trial.
(usually used in the plural) A weapon.
(in the plural) Heraldic bearings or insignia.
definitions.example: The Duke's arms were a sable gryphon rampant on an argent field.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) War; hostilities; deeds or exploits of war.
To take by the arm; to take up in one's arms.
To supply with armour or (later especially) weapons.
definitions.example: The king armed his knights with swords and shields.

definitions.definition: To prepare a tool or a weapon for action; to activate.
definitions.example: Remember to arm the alarm system before leaving for work.

definitions.definition: To cover or furnish with a plate, or with whatever will add strength, force, security, or efficiency.
definitions.example: to arm the hit of a sword; to arm a hook in angling

definitions.definition: To furnish with means of defence; to prepare for resistance; to fortify, in a moral sense.
To take up weapons; to arm oneself.
To fit (a magnet) with an armature.

Hereditary designs and symbols depicted on an escutcheon, sometimes accompanied by other elements of a heraldic achievement, such as a helm, crest, crest coronet, torse, mantling and supporters; described by a blazon.
